text: We are committed to running our business
in the most environmentally friendly way possible.
We are continuously innovating our data centers
to reduce energy use as our business grows.
I love my job at AWS because
everything I'm helping AWS accomplish
positively impacts the environment,
and as more and more customers use AWS
that positive impact is amplified.
EDP Renewables is a global leader
in the renewable energy sector.
We've worked with Paulding County for
more than eight years to develop this wind farm.
Working with hundreds of farmers, land owners and the community
to educate land owners about wind energy,
to partner with them in long-term lease agreements.
Over the past two years AWS has signed
power purchase agreements for three wind farms,
and one solar farm.
Together these projects will generate more than
1.6 million megawatt-hours of additional renewable energy annually.
That's equivalent to the energy needed to
power more than 150,000 U.S. homes for a year.
Paulding Chamber of Commerce is thrilled to celebrate
all of the renewable energy projects
that we have going on.
These are great ways for us to
develop the economic benefits locally,
and not only our county,
but the counties around us as well.
On a county level, we've been able to
give our employees raises,
the school systems have been able to add instructors,
and after construction, I know of no township road
that isn't in better condition after they've left.
Investing in this wind farm along with
our new data center region for delivering the AWS cloud
shows Amazon's long-term commitment to Ohio.
As the tech sector grows, it's important to increase
the use of renewable power
to make that growth more sustainable.
Amazon Wind Farm U.S. Central is just one example
of how AWS is working to meet its commitment to sustainability.
